revised_title: Submergence of Western Europe and Mediterranean Coasts: Evidence and Implications for the Glacial and Neolithic Periods
tldr: The author presents evidence of a submergence of Western Europe and Mediterranean coasts at the end of the glacial period, which is concurrent with an upheaval. This submergence resulted in the formation of Rubble-drift and loess deposits, which contain the remains of land animals and shells. The author argues that these deposits provide evidence for the proposed hypothesis of a submergence and subsequent upheaval of the land.
